title: LOL Client Freezing - causing computer to completely freeze
body:
So recently I have been having problems while on the LOL client menu or while in queue. While waiting for a game the client will randomly freeze, sometimes it will sometimes it won't. When the client freezes my whole computer freezes permanently and the only way to get it to work again is to hold down the power for 10 seconds and restart from there. 
This has only started happening recently, I have already tried to revert my computer to a prior date where this did not occur and ran multiple antivirus programs, however nothing has worked and my computer only locks up randomly in the LOL client menus, never in game, and never when I'm not using the LOL client, any help would be greatly appreciated!! Thanks!

replies.body: I'm having the same issues but mines in game.. it started yesterday.. I can play for like the first 30 seconds then everything freezes and I have to hold down my power button and restart my computer.. I also can't get back into the game after that

We've been seeing some reports of this recently. There's a feature inside Windows 8 - 10 that can cause these types of issues outside of a match called the SmartScreen filter. I strongly recommend you temporarily disable it using [this guide](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/930168) to see if it resolves the issue.

Let me know if that helped. Additionally, if you still have issues, let me know which version of Windows you run.

I am having the same issue, but in game like Katalix. I submitted a ticket last night or this morning (I understand it may take awhile, I am patiently waiting) regarding this here: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/23500201 
I also attached my logs to the ticket.

However, disabling SmartScreen did not help. When I went into game my computer froze again and basically forced me to hold the power button till it shut off. I have been running Windows 10 for awhile now and am only now having issues, starting yesterday night.
Also, I'm not sure if I even have Internet Explorer like the page you hyperlinked says how to "fix," because I have Microsoft Edge (even though I use Google Chrome). I was still able to disable SmartScreen in Microsoft Edge, though, as well as in my Control Panel. 
I'll copy and paste this comment to my ticket once I finish this post.

Long story short: disabling SmartScreen, in both Microsoft Edge and my Control Panel, did NOT work for me.

I was just informed by one of our tech dudes that this may be caused by some recent Windows 10 updates that re-enabled a feature called *Game DVR* inside the Windows Game Bar. I suggest [disabling the game bar entirely](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it resolves the issue for you.

Let me know if it did.
Update: the link you gave me did work, I had to use the .reg file twice for some reason to turn it off but now I seem to have no problems. Thank you!

Yes, I heard about that from The Funderfaker, too; however, I uninstalled the Xbox app as well as another Xbox file/program I do not recall the name of, prior to submitting a ticket and posting here. 
I submitted my response to him/her just now along with everything s/he asked of me. I'll keep you and this forum updated!
Also, previously I said I did not have Internet Explorer, turns out I did and disabled Smart Screen there (the issue still persisted after doing so). 

In the mean time, let me know if you hear of anything new to try!

I have solution fot those, who have tried to repair and nothing works. 
You have to change affinity to: 
1.  LeagueClient.exe , 
2.  LeagueClientUx.exe ,
3.  LeagueClientUxRender.exe ,
4.  LeagueClientUxREnder.exe 
and **enable only 2 cores**  _[ ex. CPU1 and CPU2 ]_

https://www.eightforums.com/attachments/tutorials/36501d1391416154-processor-affinity-set-applications-windows-8-a-task_manager_affinity-all.png
